column1:
ka0Qk000000DZkjIAG,kA04u0000000JX7CAM,The Netwrix FAST™ Cloud Usage Considerations,"

The Netwrix FAST™ Cloud, powered by external Threat Intelligence feeds, really does take Change Control to the next level and makes the whole process of handling events even easier by automating the analysis and approvals process. File changes can be automatically and instantly verified as ‘known safe’ as they are detected. (I.e. minimising Change Noise – leaving only unrecognised File Changes flagged up for investigation)

Netwrix FAST is a truly powerful solution to change detection, however, with great power comes great responsibility and to get the most from FAST it is imperative that your Change Tracker should be configured correctly. Here are a few dos and don'
column2:
ts to be aware of when working with the Netwrix FAST Cloud.

Do be specific with your monitoring - Take some time and work with your Netwrix Support representative to compile monitoring templates which accurately represents your organization. Bear in mind that while the FAST whitelist contains millions of files, common to all major operating systems and available applications, the cloud will not contain a record of all files in your environment!

Don'
column3:
t monitor the entire drive! - The temptation with FAST is to simply point Change Tracker at all files on a single drive! This, however, will create a large number of change events, particularly from files which will never be listed by FAST such as log files and will leave you with a massive amount of unplanned changes to review.

Do use planned change rules - If you have proprietary files which need to be tracked but will obviously never be listed in the FAST Cloud, work with Netwrix Support to create a planned change rule set so these files are picked up by an FAST alternative rule and marked as planned.

Do adjust your patching schedules - If you are currently patching immediately after a scheduled release, or have automatic updates enabled, please consider that these known good file hashes may not necessarily have reached FAST cloud as they are still being analyzed by our whitelisting experts. The recommended best practice would be to wait 2-4 weeks after a patch has been released by the vendor prior to rolling it out in your environment - permitting this is possible and if the patch is not an absolute necessity. This will ensure that FAST Cloud will contain all the necessary file hashes to fully remediate the changes generated by the patch, and also mitigate any potential post patch problems with rolling out a patch too early
column4:
which can lead to system failure until the vendor releases a fix. 

That is all there is to it
column5:
-) Hopefully, these points help to guide you in the use of the FAST Cloud but if you have any questions, please contact Netwrix Support through the Helpdesk Portal or by emailing Support@nntws.com. To further your ‘Change Control’ experience, you may also want to check out Netwrix’s Change Control Service, which is a managed service option designed to further enhance your ability to contain and control changes within your environment: https://www.newnettechnologies.com/nnt-recommended-change-control-program.html

",2025-05-05T10:57:43.000+0000,Online

column2: >Installing Netwrix Agent App for Solaris (SPARC and Intel)

column1: The Netwrix Change Tracker Enterprise Agent for Linux/Unix uses a Mono runtime instead of the Microsoft .NET framework used on Windows. Netwrix provide pre-built runtime file sets for Solaris hosts which can be simply downloaded and unzipped on the target host, along with the Netwrix AgentApp file set. Solaris will typically require the libstdc++ package to be added. This can be acquired from the official Oracle website or from
Download the required files for your version of Solaris from the
column3:
>Netwrix Members Area[ |http://www.newnettechnologies.com/members-area/member-2/cat_view/6-support-information-for-existing-customers/23-nnt-agent-app-nix-runtime-packages.html]. This will almost certainly comprise of a GC and mono zip file. For example, Solaris 10 Intel requires the following:
gc-7.5-solaris-10-intel
Solaris 10 Intel Mono Runtime (Mono 3.2.3)
The Netwrix Agent installation file set (NNTAgent-1.0.0.xxx-yyy.zip can be downloaded from the
column7: >. Copy the three zip files onto your host using scp / WinSCP. The file should be copied to the /opt directory.

column1:

$ unzip gc-7.5-solaris-10-intel.zip
$ unzip mono-3.2.3-solaris-10-intel.zip
You should then have /opt/mono and /opt/gc directory in the root of /opt.

ka0Qk000000DZZRIA4,kA04u0000000JQkCAM,9 Upgrade from Netwrix Agent App to Netwrix Gen 7 Agent,"<h1 id=""id-9UpgradefromNNTAgentApptoNNTGen7Agent-_Toc484003706UpgradefromNNTAgentApptoNNTGen7Agent""><span style=""color: rgb(46,116,181)
column2: >Upgrade from Netwrix Agent App to Netwrix Gen 7 Agent

column1:
If you are currently using an Netwrix Agent App (Version 1.0.0.x) and you wish to upgrade to use the Gen 7 Agent instead, the procedure is straightforward but as with any software upgrade, there may be additional steps required depending on your individual circumstances.
The high-level overview is this

1. Stop Agent App service (you may choose to uninstall the program at this stage)
  2. Run installer for Gen 7 Agent to install
  3. Hub details, Agent username and password are required
  4. Thumbprint may be required if using a private certificate on your Hub server

1. IMPORTANT Do not set either a Nameprefix or Namesuffix for the Agent name – if the Gen 7 Agent registers with the same Host Name as the Agent App is using, the Gen 7 Agent will simply assume the identity of the Agent App and therefore event and report continuity will be ensured
  2. Once the Gen 7 Agent is operational you can then remove the Agent App (if you didn'
column2: t already do this in step 1)

column1: Step 1 – Stop the Netwrix Agent App Service
Windows – Either use the MS Services Console (Run ->
column2: services.msc) or use Command Line as Administrator – sc stop NNTAgentService

column1:
Windows – See Installing Gen 7 Agent for Windows
Linux – See Installing Gen 7 Agent for Linux

Debian - from terminal
apt-get remove nnt-agent
apt-get remove nnt-mono

column2:
ll then want to remove the Netwrix Gen 7 Agent files which will be found at
rm -fr /opt/nnt
rm -fr /opt/mono

ll then want to remove the Netwrix Gen 7 Agent files which will be found at
rm -fr /var/nnt
rm -fr /opt/nnt
rm -fr /opt/mono Finally – Please contact Netwrix Support if you need help at any stage

Problem

Running the Netwrix Gen 7 Agent installer on a Windows system and entering in the correct Hub credentials gives an error when running a test on the hub connection before proceeding with the full setup:

1. Download the Easy Fix tool here
  2. Run through with installing the hotfix
  3. Close down the Netwrix Gen 7 Agent installer if it is still open

column3: s files are signed with a certificate and therefore Windows will attempt to confirm the validity of the certificate as the service starts. ka0Qk000000DSBNIA4,kA04u0000000JUICA2,How to Configure Agentless File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) in Netwrix Change Tracker,"

Overview

Netwrix Change Tracker supports an Agentless approach to monitoring, which is useful for endpoints such as firewalls, routers, switches, appliances, or legacy Unix hosts. This approach is also ideal for quick, software-free implementations for monitoring Windows/Linux systems. Agentless File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) is performed using a dedicated Proxy Agent or the Proxy Agent function of the Netwrix Change Tracker Agent.

Agentless scanning options include SSH, Telnet with full shell/command operation, CLI interaction, and Windows SMB/Named Pipe. Scans can be operated using the NNT-FileHash binary, a dissolvable/transient program that simplifies system integrity monitoring where file hash-based tracking is required. The Proxy Agent concept provides advantages in that setup and control of Agentless monitoring is consistent with Agent-based monitoring.
Follow these steps to configure a device for Agentless monitoring:

1. Register the Proxy Agent to the Change Tracker Hub.
  2. Select the Proxy Agent to use for Agentless monitoring.
  3. Enter the details of the new endpoint device for Agentless monitoring:
    • Name/IP Address
    • (Optional) Device Type
    • (Optional) Display IP/Name
    • Credentials used for connection (select from the dropdown list of stored credentials)
  4. (Optional) If hash-based FIM is required, locate the relevant NNT_FILEHASH binary onto the host and add the path for the binary to the login script. This generates a cryptographic hash value for a file, providing a unique "
column3: for the file that changes substantially even for minor modifications.

column1: Conceptually, all endpoint devices that need to be monitored using an Agentless approach must be associated with a Proxy Agent. This allows appropriate relationships to be established between the most local or best-resourced Proxy Agent and the endpoints to be monitored. For example, all devices at Customer Site A would naturally be associated with a Proxy Agent deployed to this site.

This problem occurs when a device that has the same name as an already registered agent attempts to connect to the Netwrix Change Tracker. When an agent connects, it receives an identifier called the agent.id file, which contains an alphanumeric ID for identification purposes. If the "

  5. Delete all files within the %ProgramData%\NNT\gen7agent.service folder except the Hubdetails.xml and agent.id file.

ka0Qk000000DOPVIA4,kA04u0000000JP9CAM,How to Determine Your .NET Framework Version,"

Question
How can I determine the version of .NET Framework installed on my system?

Netwrix Change Tracker Gen 7 Hub and Agent require a specific version of .NET Framework. This article provides instructions to help you determine which version of .NET Framework is installed on your system.

1. Press Windows Key+R to open the Run command box.
  2. Type regedit and click OK.
  3. Navigate to the following registry key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP\v4\Full.
  4. Locate the Release DWORD value. Refer to the screenshot below for guidance:
• The output will display the Release number of the installed .NET Framework version. Refer to the screenshot below for an example:

ka0Qk0000003s3tIAA,kA04u0000000JQ6CAM,1 Overview and Introduction,"
column2:
>Overview and Introduction

Netwrix Change Tracker Gen 7 represents a quantum leap in file integrity monitoring technology, intelligently analyzing events to highlight genuine security incidents.


Netwrix Change Tracker has been awarded Certified Vendor status by the Center for Internet Security, providing confidence that CIS Benchmark hardening guidelines are always accurately applied to eliminate known vulnerabilities from all common platforms.


But detection of host intrusion and breach activity to combat the threats of spear phishing, contemporary malware and APT-style attacks also requires a forensic visibility of system integrity changes. Providing this level of detection-sensitivity also inevitably amplifies the regular background noise generated from system patching and routine application operation.


Until now, getting the best from file integrity monitoring has resulted in products like Tripwire Enterprise – needing complicated rules to be configured to minimize change noise and constant manual-review of events before accepted changes are '
column4:
.
Not any more. Change Tracker Gen 7 re-invents file integrity monitoring making it easy to use and even more effective for breach detection. The key difference is Closed-Loop Intelligent Change Control (CLICC).


CLICC reconciles the security benefits of forensic change control with the detailed workload necessary to review changes.


The solution is '
column8:
, because any changes made are automatically assessed against expected or permitted changes to the configuration baseline, delivering all the benefits of zero tolerance to unplanned changes and a super-sensitive breach detection capability, but without the time-consuming, resource-intensive (and boring) post-implementation review burden. Planned change blueprints can be recorded from observed system behavior, continually enhancing system intelligence through recognition of regular behavior such as patching changes.
By automatically assessing changes, all expected/pre-approved changes such as known patching updates can be isolated leaving just unplanned changes – potentially breach activity - exposed, to then be properly investigated.

  • Approve changes to the authorized baseline with a simple point and click
  • All new GUI – contemporary mobile app-style web interface
  • All new Hub – Now 100% event-driven, faster and more scalable to handle large Enterprise deployments, supported on both Windows and Linux
  • Auto-Provisioning of monitoring policy and scheduled reporting – workflow of assigning devices to groups, assigning policies and scheduling regular reports automated – even Enterprise estates are easy to manage
  • Integration-Ready for all Service Desk and other 3rd Party Service Delivery management tools – comprehensive REST API provides full two-way integration with change/incident management systems
  • New Scheduled Report operation – report on any events for any devices on a one-off or scheduled basis
  • CIS Certified Vendor accreditation for a complete range of platform-hardening best-practice guidance
  • Pinpoint breach activity in real-time – expected and pre-approved changes are automatically assessed to leave just unplanned, unexpected and potential security incidents for review

Overview

If you have set up a proxy internet connection on your Change Tracker Server and you find that FAST Cloud is not working as expected, follow the instructions below to configure proxy settings for the IIS processes.
Click New to create a new environment variable under the System Variables heading.
NOTE: This should be the IP and port of the proxy server.
After creating the environment variable, click OK to apply the changes.
Once the environment variable is configured, restart the Change Tracker server. The FAST Cloud should now function as expected.

column1: In Netwrix Change Tracker, when an Events query includes a text search, it generates a simple System Error message in the lower-right corner of the screen indicating that the query will not complete successfully or that it will time out.

column1: What transport layer security (TLS) versions are supported for in-transit data encryption in Netwrix Change Tracker?
What options are supported for at-rest data encryption in MongoDB in Change Tracker?

TLS protocol version 1.3 and earlier are supported for in-transit data encryption. It is recommended to disable nontarget protocol versions in your environment to ensure the intended TLS version is used.

MongoDB Community Edition, which is included in the Change Tracker installation wizard, does not support at-rest data encryption. This feature is available in MongoDB Enterprise only. Learn more in Encryption At-Rest · MongoDB 🡥

column2: >IMPORTANT: Data such as user accounts, passwords, and network device credentials is encrypted using the ASP.NET Core data protection API by default. This type of data is encrypted in both the Community and Enterprise editions of MongoDB.

ka0Qk0000001NnNIAU,kA0Qk0000000NuHKAU,Disk Space Occupied by Core.* Files in Gen 7 Agent Servers,"

Questions
The opt/nnt/gen7agent/bin/ directory in Gen 7 Agent servers contains multiple core.* files.
If it safe to delete these files?

The core.* files located in the opt/nnt/gen7agent/bin/ directory are core dumps. These core dumps are generated upon a process crash or a fatal error − they contain a snapshot of the process memory at the time of the crash or error.
These core files can be safely deleted to free up disk space.

ka0Qk0000000x9lIAA,kA04u0000000JdFCAU,How to Authenticate to Log Tracker with Active Directory Login,"

Log Tracker allows you to login to the system using Active Directory authentication by configuring the "
column5:
screen. This lets you use your active directory password when logging into Log Tracker, and provides a few other benefits also.

To use this function, the Log Tracker Server needs to be part of the Active Directory domain. (The Log Tracker Server authenticates the login user to the host platform, and if the platform is part of the domain, you can then use your Active Directory password, or a local password configured for the host platform.)

Here is a configuration procedure.

First, verify that Log Tracker Server is part of the domain. You can find out if this is true by successfully logging into the platform (not the web interface, but the actual platform running Log Tracker) with your active directory user name and password.

After verifying the above, login to the Log Tracker Server web interface with an "
column7: type login and execute the following steps.

type user to the system.

as the user name. Note that you can enter a local password, but that password will generally be ignored. (It can be used as a backup password to permit you access should Active Directory not be available during the logon process.)

column38:

link in the upper right of the display.

Note that, on the login screen, a drop-down menu appears that will let you login to the system using your Active Directory login name and password, or the password configured for you on the local platform (if any), or using the internal password configured in step 1 above.

Generally, the above steps are all that is necessary to configure the active directory interface. Various other options also exist, such as the ability to authenticate a user based upon an Active Directory group name, and the ability to disable any local logins using a password configured within Log Tracker.

ka0Qk0000000x89IAA,kA04u0000000Je3CAE,Log Tracker - Types of Authentication,"

Internal security of your Log Tracker data, and the permissions granted to access this data, are both important topics that should be considered by all Log Tracker administrators. Log Tracker server potentially contains private data, especially with regard to user activity, and the Log Tracker data should be protected to prevent user privacy and other concerns.
Log Tracker Server provides multiple types of logon authentication, documented in the Log Tracker manuals, and summarized here.

<ul><li>HTTP Authentication. The out-of-box authentication used by Log Tracker is HTTP Authentication, which is a tried and true form of authentication used by the web browser. The Log Tracker administrator updates a local database of users and permissions via the &quot
column5: screen. This type of authentication has many benefits: It is verifiable
column6: it is an industry standard method
column7: it is very convenient. The only disadvantage to this type of authentication is that HTTP authentication does not provide a &quot
column9:
mechanism. To log out of the server (once logged in) you need to close all instances of your browser.
  • Web Screen Authentication: An alternate form of authentication is "
column15: tab. To switch to this type of authentication, set the &quot
column23: . This type of authentication provides a traditional login screen, requires cookies in your browser to be enabled, and provides a &quot
column25:
link. This type of authentication is quite popular, and has the benefit of easily permitting the user to switch logons.
  • HTTP Auth + Web Screen. This is simply a combination of both HTTP and Web Screen. The user must logon once using HTTP authentication, and then can logon again under the same user name (or switch user names.) This is probably not required except at those sites that need to demonstrate and prove verifiable security.
  • Active Directory User Authentication. This type of logon uses "
column27: logons. It works only for the &quot
column29: type of Login authentication. The user simply sets the &quot
column37: screen. Then, when a user logs into the system using one of the names specified on the &quot
column42:
s password can be authenticated against Active Directory (instead of the local login database.)
  • Active Directory Group Authentication. This type of logon is similar to the above, except the user name does not have to be configured in the "
column46: screen. The permissions of the user are assigned via the &quot
column50: tab. To use this type of authentication requires installation of the ADGM (Active Directory Group Mapping) adapter, available from Log Tracker

column1:
The precise method of authentication is fairly arbitrary. Any of the above techniques can provide sound security of your data. The particular technique employed by and end-user depends largely on convenience, the need to verify the security (such as prove to auditors the data is secure) and how paranoid an organization may be in protecting the Log Tracker data.

ka04u000001181EAAQ,kA04u00000111HUCAY,File Is Being Used by Another Process Error in Netwrix Change Tracker,"

Symptom
The following error is prompted when attempting to run a report in Netwrix Change Tracker:
The process cannot access the file &#39
column3: because it is being used by another process.

column1: The %path_to_file% path may differ depending on the affected report. (E.g., C:\Windows\TEMP\1-11530090-NNT CIS Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Benchmark - Level 2 Member Server.json.)
The antivirus (AV) or endpoint detection and response (EDR) solution installed in your environment is conflicting with Netwrix Change Tracker.

Make sure the top-level folder of the affected path are excluded from the monitoring scope of your AV or EDR solution to prevent further conflicts. This would apply to real-time scans and backups. For the example path provided, it is recommended to exclude C:\Windows\TEMP.

Exclude Netwrix Change Tracker folders, services, and processes from the monitoring scope of your AV and EDR. Refer to the following article for additional information: Antivirus Exclusions for Netwrix Change Tracker.
Antivirus Exclusions for Netwrix Change Tracker

ka04u000000QmlUAAS,kA04u0000000JWnCAM,MongoDB Log Fix. Error reading collection: an operation on a socket could not be performed because the system lacked sufficient buffer space or because a queue was full,"

Question
I try to perform a MongoDump on me Mongo Database. How to troubleshoot if the MongoDump failed?
Failed: error reading collection: WSARecv tcp 127.0.0.1:50290: An operation on a socket could not be performed because the system lacked sufficient buffer space or because a queue was full.

The error message is linked to a Windows issue, rather than a MongoDB issue. The error is seen when a system tries to connect to a TCP port which is greater than 5000 and if you look at the error message the TCP port should be referenced.
Read more about cause and resolution of this issue. If possible, please implement the steps they recommend and then re-run the mongo dump task.

<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
This means that your MongoDB service has crashed because the system ran out of Physical and Virtual Memory. Typically, this is due to misconfigured Page File Settings.

If you are receiving this error, the Netwrix Change Tracker Database and Hub Server are NOT functioning. This is a critical error and for monitoring to continue, it must be resolved. To resolve this error:

1. Open Run by typing the Windows+R key on your keyboard
  2. Type in SYSDM.CPL and hit Enter
  3. This will open up Advanced System Settings. Click on the Advanced tab
  4. Under Performance, click on Settings...
  5. In the Performance Options Menu, click the Advanced tab
  6. Under Virtual Memory click on Change
  7. Verify that Virtual Memory is System managed
column4:
asPdf=false"">
 
  • If it is not set to System managed, please configure that by selecting the System managed size radio button
  • Click OK
  • In some scenarios, it may be best to reboot the server.

column2: >NOTE: MongoDB has garbage which clean up physical and virtual memory. MongoDB tries to reserve as much memory as possible, even though it is not using it. It gladly will give up this memory to the systems that need it. Any queries run get stored into the page file for easy access. If this is not system managed, when it reaches the limit, it will crash the mongo database service. Having the C drive set to system managed is the best way to ensure excellent performance from both the system, as well as the database itself.

ka04u000000QmcHAAS,kA04u0000000JV2CAM,How to Regenerate All The Threads From Log Data (Log Tracker),"

Overview

It may be necessary to regenerate all the thread catalogs from existing log data. This might be important to recover from a crash, or prior to conducting a reporting session or forensic investigation.
The cli-bin tools include a program called CGenx.exe, which can be used to regenerate a catalog of any type. This tool requires administrative access to the system, and can be run at a command prompt to regenerate a catalog from an existing log file.
To regenerate all thread catalogs for all log data, you can compose a simple batch file as follows, and place this file in the cli-bin folder.
column2:
>IMPORTANT. The batch file may take many hours or even days to complete (depending on the amount of data on the system.) 
For example, a simple REGEN_ALL_THREADS.bat batch, which iterates across all existing log files in the C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite\logs folder, and regenerates all threads, might look like the following:

column1: REM: Regenerate all thread catalogs from the files
REM: found in the C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite\logs folder
for %%F in (C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite\logs\*.log) do (

1. Cut and paste the above batch file into the REGEN_ALL_THREADS.bat file
  2. Place this in the cli-bin folder
  3. To regenerate all threads from all log data, execute the file (as an Administrator)
  4. If your log data is contained in a non-standard location on your system, you may need to change the value of
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite\logs

The above batch file uses standard Windows Batch File syntax to run the CGenx.exe program for each log file in the logs folder. The batch file syntax may seem a little obscure to you, but has been around for fifteen years, works perfectly on all Windows platforms. See the article below for assistance with this batch file syntax:
You can change the -thread option to -all (or some other CGenx option) to regenerate all catalogs (or some other specific catalog, such as devices, facilities, severities, users, etc.)

ka04u000000Qmc7AAC,kA04u0000000JdQCAU,MongoDB - Pre-allocated Log Files. Disk Space Errors,"

Problem
The number of pre-allocated log files grows unbounded in MongoDB Version 3.6.3 and the MongoDB service unexpectedly stops on the server and the following errors are reported in the mongod.log file:
2018-11-29T14:48:23.440+0000 E STORAGE  [thread16497] WiredTiger error (28) [1543502903:439454][5596:140717558290144], log-server: log pre-alloc server error: No space left on device
2018-11-29T14:48:23.440+0000 E STORAGE  [thread16497] WiredTiger error (28) [1543502903:440450][5596:140717558290144], log-server: log server error: No space left on device

2018-11-29T14:48:23.440+0000 E STORAGE  [thread16497] WiredTiger error (-31804) [1543502903:440450][5596:140717558290144], log-server: the process must exit and restart: WT_PANIC: WiredTiger library panic

The log file seems to indicate that there is no disk space left on the device, however, checking the storage available on the server seems to say otherwise where there is more than enough storage available.
The problem above seems to be a bug in MongoDB version 3.6.3 and is an issue which has been resolved in version 3.6.4.

1. Head to the MongoDB website and download the following version:
    win32/mongodb-win32-x86_64-2008plus-ssl-3.6.4-signed.msi.
  2. Install it on the Change Tracker Server where MongoDB resides.

ka04u000000Qmc2AAC,kA04u0000000JTRCA2,How to Detect a Windows System Time Change With the Log Tracker Server?,"

Question
How to detect a Windows system time change with the Log Tracker Server?

First, you will need to have the Log Tracker Windows Agent installed on the Windows platform. By default, the agent configuration monitors changes to the system clock, and will generate a system message such as the following if the system clock is changed:
Security 4616: Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing: The system time was changed.
This event is generated when the system time is changed. (Audit Success)

No other action (other than installing the agent) is necessary to get the above messages correctly logged.
If you would like to trigger an alert if the above message occurs, match the above message in the Alerts >
column2:
Device screen. You can set up a single alert across all devices.
If you set up an alert, you will then receive a ticket if the system time changes for any device.

ka04u000000QmbnAAC,kA04u0000000JfkCAE,HTTP Error 500.19 - Internal Server Error - Error Code 0x8007007e,"

Problem and Cause

The requested page cannot be accessed because the related configuration data for the page is invalid.This problem is related to the XPress compression schema module (suscomp.dll) which gets installed with WSUS. Compression schemes are defined globally and they try to load in every Application Pool. It will result in this error when the 64 Bit version of suscomp.dll attempts to load in an Application Pool which is running in 32 Bit mode [enable32BitAppOnWin64]. 32 Bit mode is needed for SafeGuard Enterprise Server to run.

1. Navigate to %WINDIR%\system32\inetsrv\config\
  2. Create a backup copy of the file applicationhost.config and save it to a different location
  3. Open the applicationhost.config in the Notepad
  4. Search for the following entry:
  5. Remove / Disable the XPress compression schema line from the configurationfile
  6. Save the applicationhost.config and restart IIS services.
For more information, read the Troubleshooting HTTP 500.19 Errors in IIS 7 article.

Problem
When any Change Tracker user is browsing to the Change Tracker Dashboard tab or the Device tab, a red error message box appears on screen stating - "
column2: Error, the requested event counts summary size cannot be smaller than the system event count window size"

column1: To resolve the issue, the user will need to ensure that the Change Tracker EventStatsUnitSeconds configuration item is to set to a factor of 86400.

The default value is set to 1800. If the error message is seen, this implies that the current value is not a whole number multiple of 86400 and the value will need to be corrected. To check and correct the value, please follow the steps below:
If the config item cannot be found, use the ‚ÄúAdd Config Item‚Äù to create it.
If Value is not set or value is not 1800, select the Edit button next to EventStatsUnitSeconds and change value accordingly.
Log out and login to Change Tracker.

ka04u000000HdB8AAK,kA04u0000000JfQCAU,Differences between Greenbone Community Feed and the Enterprise Feed,"

There are three main areas of difference between the professional solution and the community edition.

1) The feed
The following list gives some examples of those professional enterprise-grade products which are only part of the professional Greenbone Security Feed:
- Generally, all Enterprise-grade products and all OT (i.e. ICS/SCADA) products
- MS Windows Server and back office solutions (e.g.: SharePoint, sql Server, others)
- Products from Palo Alto Networks, Cisco, Juniper Networks and Fortinet
- Oracle Solaris IBM WebSphere products (i.e. IBM WebSphere Application Server)
- Lotus Notes or SAP products
- VMWare paid products

2) Solution delivery, deployment, and support
Probably nothing surprising here, the professional solution gets a full, SLA based support. The community edition not. There is more related to the appliances, which may not be relevant here.

3) Features
The basic features are the same, still, some enterprise-oriented features are not part of the community edition. As examples:
- feed updates via S-Proxy
- system updates and upgrades included in the feed
- connectors to other Enterprise products like PaloAlto firewalls, SIEM systems, similar
- backup/restore, alarms/schedules
- Master/Slave architecture

The default behavior of Change Tracker when sending real time email notifications is to wait and compile multiple changes into a single email. In some instances, it may be necessary to have each change separated into its own email address. Below is a guide on how to force Change Tracker to send each change as its own email.

ka04u000000HdB1AAK,kA04u0000000JewCAE,Redis - QFork.dat Files Taking Up Large Amounts Of Disk Space?,"

Have you noticed that the server hosting your Change Tracker web console is running low on disk space? Have you scanned the servers disks and found that the culprit is a RedisQFork.dat files? Are you unsure of what the files are and if it is safe to delete them? If so, please read the guide below for your answer!

column2: >The files that you may be faced with are normally stored in the following directory: C:\Windows\ServiceProfiles\NetworkService\AppData\Local\Redis

column1: These files are created due to Redis using the fork UNIX system API to create a point-in-time snapshot of the data store for storage to disk.
column2: >Windows does not have a fork-like API available, so Redis opted to simulate this behavior by placing the Redis heap in a memory mapped file that can be shared with a child(quasi-forked) process and b<span style=""color: rgb(36,41,46)
column3: >y default the size of each snapshot file should be equal to the size of the devices physical memory.

column1:
If you encounter this problem, it is safe to delete these files, as long as the Redis service is not running.

ka04u000000HdAeAAK,kA04u0000000JdKCAU,"Log Tracker - I Am Getting a ""Correlation Delay"" Advisory. What should I do?","

This advisory indicates you are receiving data faster than you can correlate it, this may be a temporary condition you can ignore or a pathological condition that will just get worse unless you address it. Basically, this indication indicates an overload condition -- temporary or chronic.

Here are some recommendations:

The fastest way to immediately increase your capacity is to redirect certain messages to an "
column5: messages. This single change will probably increase your capacity by 20% or more. Note that you do this via the &quot
column10: t necessarily lose these messages permanently. (You can set &quot
column18: screen.) See screenshot 1 and screenshot 2 below for help:

column4:
asPdf=false"">

Another good alternative is to make your correlation thread match patterns more efficient., You need to know that the most time-consuming type of correlation rule is something like "
column5: A or B or C or D) (i.e. a match pattern that is a series of &quot
column7: match patterns.) Although these are still evaluated very fast, they begin to chew up a lot of time because you are comparing each &quot
column9: component against all messages you receive, scanning the message over and over again. This can burn up &quot
column11:
time.

So if you are sending messages at a very high rate, you can reduce correlation load substantially by doing any of these things:

column3: file. (Note that this does not necessarily mean you are actually losing data since this data can be archived off.)

column7: of the message (in addition to a &quot
column9: ) This reduces the correlation delay by limiting the amount of data you have to pass through the correlation rules.

column1: Convert your match pattern to something like this: "
column2: X and (A or B or C or D)&quot
column3: i.e. find a common keyword that you can compare with as a first step in the correlation rule.

column1: Item #3 above may require you to take a look at all your thread match expressions to see how efficient they are, Note that you can see the load that is being used up for your correlation threads using the "
column3: link, found at the bottom of the &quot

You can make the above thread match expression MUCH more efficient by simply making the thread match pattern like this:
In the above case, we just bypass further testing of the message unless "
column3: is present in the thread -- this saves us time. (If it the message does not have &quot
column5: in the message, there is no use evaluating the rule further.

(or whatever) that makes the correlation rule work even faster!

KEEP IN MIND that ALL MESSAGES are compared to ALL CORRELATION THREADS. You can decrease "

ka04u000000HdAYAA0,kA04u0000000Jd0CAE,How to Acquire AD / LDAP Information From Multiple Servers (Log Tracker),"

s inetpub directory informs the Change Tracker Hub of where it database resides and how to communicate with the database. ka04u000000HdAIAA0,kA04u0000000Jc7CAE,How to Move The Log Tracker Server To A New Platform,"

You can move your Log Tracker Server installation to a new platform simply, without losing any log data or configuration data.

The entire Log Tracker Server software is contained in the root Log Tracker folder (by default C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite, but often some other location.) This makes it easy to copy all files associated with the server to a new location, either a new disk or a completely new computer system.
To relocate the Log Tracker server to a new platform, perform the following simple steps:

column3: with the Windows Service Manager, and verify with the task manager that all &quot
column5:
processes are stopped.
  • Copy ALL the files in Log Tracker root folder over to a new location, such as with a file system share. Note that this can be a large amount of data that may take several minutes or even hours to complete.
  • If the log files and archive files reside in a location that is different from the default location (as configured on the "
column9: screen) copy these files to the new platform also, to a folder that is the same as on the old folder (such as D:\Logs and D:\Archives). This is only necessary if you have configured a non-default location for these files, on the &quot
column13:
screen.
  • After all files are copied, on the new Log Tracker Server platform,run the "
column15:
program as administrator. This re-installs and configures program services at the new location, and restarts the ‚ÄúCorreLog Framework service‚Äù.
  • If the Apache-TLS server is installed, also run the "
column17:
program. This step e-configures the Apache-TLS process to use the new location as its document root directory. (This step also creates a new self-signed certificate for the Apache TLS server.)
  • Rename or delete the old installation after successfully moving the directory, to avoid future confusion.

column1: It is possible (but not likely) that you have some paths in custom alerts, custom actions, or the local windows agent that need to be adjusted. This is not common, but should be mentioned.

BE AWARE that the IP address of the Log Tracker server is configured as the message destination on all your managed network devices, hence it may require substantial reconfiguration of your network devices if you want to change the IP Address of the Log Tracker Server. For best results, just assign the old IP address of the Log Tracker Server to the new platform, and decomission the old platform completely.

ka04u000000HdAEAA0,kA04u0000000JbnCAE,Brief Information On The Agent Files,"

Below is a description of the files contained within the agent installation path as of agent version 7.0.0.32:

  • Agent.id‚Äì When an agent is installed, it is assigned a unique ID and this is where it is contained.
  • MasterDevice.json ‚ÄìThis contains the details of the master proxy device which is always the local agent. It also contains the parameters on how the agent interacts with remote systems/databases that it has been tasked with monitoring.
  • ProxiedDevices.json ‚Äì This file contains an array of all the devices being proxied by the agent. For devices where you cannot install the agent, they will be proxied so for that reason the agent stores the names of the devices currently being proxied by the agent for its record.
  • Events.db - This stores the events data captured by Change Tracker.
  • Config.xml ‚Äì This file contains the devices configuration data. It holds information of what directories, registry items and security policies are being tracked by the agent.
  • Store.db ‚Äì All of the baseline information is stored here.
  • Rolling-log.txt ‚Äì This file contains log data that has been generated by the agent that reports to Change Tracker. It is helpful for troubleshooting when issues arise as it holds data such as any errors that have occurred with the agent, when compliance reports run, if there are any error with the compliance report that have run, when the agent goes online/offline, etc.
  • HubDetails.xml‚Äì This file contains details related to the Change Tracker server and this information allows the agent to be able to authenticate to the Change Tracker server. Information such as the username, password, HUB URL, proxy information, etc. are stored in here.

ka04u000000HdAAAA0,kA04u0000000JbTCAU,How to Retransmit Messages With Log Tracker CLI-BIN Tools,"

When forwarding messages from Log Tracker Server to a third-party SIEM system, there may be situations or times that you need to resend and retransmit messages that were not forwarded. This may occur if, for example, the third-party SIEM was down or inaccessible to Log Tracker Server for an extended period of time.
You can retransmit any or all Log Tracker Server messages using the command line tools residing in the CLI-BIN folder of the Log Tracker Server.
Specifically, to retransmit all the messages for a specific date and time range, you can execute the following at a command prompt or within a batch file:
<pre class="""">cd C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite\cli-bin
The above command sequence first creates a file "
column3: that contain all the messages for the date YYYY/MM/DD starting at the time HH:MM:SS, to a maximum of N messages. This is done by the CatMsg.exe program, which is one of several ways of listing messages from the message archive.
file is created, the user can send this data to the third-party SIEM or syslog collector at the IP address &quot

There are two options that control the online and archive retention within Log Tracker. Log Tracker utilizes a web based menu and both can be accessed from the following menu:Messages >
column10: . The first parameter specifies the duration for how long the Log Tracker event data is kept online. This value can be from 7 to 500 days. ka04u000000HdA8AAK,kA04u0000000JbOCAU,Adding SSL Certificates to Log Tracker Server Web Interface,"

Log Tracker Server uses a "
column3: certificate to authenticate the Log Tracker Server, which may be suitable for a wide range of activities within your organization. However, without taking special action (as discussed here) your browser will display a warning message when the web server is accessed, which may be annoying or unacceptable for some organizations.

column1: To definitively remove all certificate errors that appear in browsers, you should purchase a certificate from a "
column3: and install this certificate as discussed below.
server on your platform and executing the setup procedure, perform the following actions:

(CA) such as Comodo or DigiCert and indicate you would like to purchase a web certificate for the Log Tracker Server platform. Note that this is always a fee based service, and Log Tracker cannot do this for you (for security reasons).
  • Review the Certificate Authorities instructions to you (if any.) The Certificate Authority may ask for a CSR (Certificate Signing Request) file for the server. If they ask for this item, send this file to them:

column1: Note: the above file is created by the Log Tracker Apache TLS setup wizard, and contains information regarding the name of the platform where Log Tracker Server is executing. The name of the platform, used in the URL, is critical, and cannot be changed without creating a new certificate for the platform.
3.The Certificate Authoritywill send you back a "
column5: suffix, but is the same file.) This is your web server security certificate, which must be installed at the Log Tracker Server site,Note that this will normally occur ONLY after fees are paid, and after the Certificate Authority has verified your company identity.

column1: 4. Copy the file received from the Certificate Authority to the following location:

Note: overwrite the file existing file with the purchased security certificate. It is advisable to backup both the old and new files, and keep these files in a secure and private location. These files should not be made publicly available, and should be considered confidential to your organization.
5. Stop and restart the "
6.Access the Log Tracker Server website with your browser, and verify that all warnings or errors are now gone.

If you still see a warning or error, then the most likely cause is that the host name in the certificate does not agree with the host name in the URL. Note that these two values must agree perfectly. For example, if the certificate contains the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN), then that name must be used when accessing the Log Tracker Server, or an error will be displayed by the browser. The host name in the certificate is contained in the "
column3: file, generated by the Apache TLS Setup wizard. If you need to generate a new &quot
column5: file, run the C:\Program Files (x86)\NNT Log Tracker Suite \apache-tls\bin\MAKE_CERT.bat&quot

ka04u000000Hd9pAAC,kA04u0000000JaBCAU,"Rolling-Log Fix: ""ERROR ConfigurationLoader - Hub location details have not been specified. Please edit the following file to specify hub location and account details: /var/nnt/gen7agent.service/HubDetails.xml”","

This problem can occur when the Agent password being sent to the Hub Server is incorrect.
<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
Example Error Message
2017-07-10 19:49:59,891 [1] ERROR ConfigurationLoader - Hub location details have not been specified.
Please edit the following file to specify hub location and account details: /var/nnt/gen7agent.service/HubDetails.xml
This means that the agent could not locate the HubDetails.xml file, which is responsible for telling the agent how to connect to the NNT Hub Server

column2: >How Can I Fix This / Should I Worry?

column1: If you are receiving this error, the NNT Agent is NOT reporting to your hub. This is a critical error and for monitoring to continue, it must be resolved. To resolve this error:

1. Stop the NNT Agent Service.
  2. Run the NNT Connection Script by issuing the following command: "
column4: - Complete the requested details

column1:
1. Stop the NNT Agent Service
  2. Navigate to your NNT Agent Directory Which contains the Rolling-Log Files - Which is defined in this article -NNT Software Problem? What Info Should I Provide?
  3. Modify the HubDetails.xml (A known good HubDetails.XML example is below)
  4. Modify the HubURL and insert yours in its place.
  5. Remove the Tags as they are the agent password which has been encrypted - If there are any.
  6. In the place of the Tags, enter the Tags - See example hubdetails below. The default password is used as an example.
  7. In between the password entries, enter your Agent Account password as defined on your NNT Hub Server.
  8. In between the Thumbprint entries, enter your custom certificate thumbprint if you have one. If you do not have a custom and are using the default, leave it blank.
  9. Save the file out, replacing the old one. Note that you may need to save this to the desktop and copy and paste replacing the old file back into the directory.
  10. Restart the agent service

column2: >When you start the service, the agent will automatically re-encrypt your password, and the E1 tags will replace the password tags. Also, There is a ten minute cool off when this happens. Now that the username and password has been corrected the agent should register after the ten minutes has elapsed. This cool off period is counted at the NNT Hub server, and does not take effect at the agent level. If you have stopped the service, you do not have to wait 10 minutes after restarting it.

ka04u000000Hd9mAAC,kA04u0000000JZwCAM,"Rolling-Log Fix: ""ItemStoragePipeline - Error processing item, couldn't collect filehashsha256 for file: /mydir/my.file Error: Failed to collect data for attribute (Could not find file /mydir/my.file)""","<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
column2:
>
Example Error Message

column1: 2017-10-11 08:11:18,385 [4] ERROR ItemStoragePipeline - Error processing item, couldn&#39
column2: t collect filehashsha256 for file: /etc/rc6.d/K05dsmcad Error: Failed to collect data for attribute (Could not find file &quot

>What Does It Mean?

This error occurs when you have your configuration template in Change Tracker looking to track a file and the agent cannot hash the file because it is not found. In this case, we are looking to track "
column5:
>How Can I Fix This / Should I Worry?

If you are recieving this for a file that actually does not exist, then no, do not worry. If you are using one template to track multiple agents, and some agents do have the file, while others dont, it is not a problem to let it track this file. The only caution to have with this is the amount of files it is looking for. If the template grows exponentially, having a large volume of these errors may cause performance issues, however, in most cases, it is perfectly fine.


If you are positive the file exists, but are getting this error, do the following

  1. Check your configuration template. Is it looking for the file in the same place you have placed the file?
  2. Is this a file that is in different places on different servers? if so, please define all of the potential spots in the template.
  3. Does this file have special permissions that do not allow it to be read by our agent? If so, adjust the file permissions, or adjust the privilages of the account our agent uses.
column6:
>In most cases, you can simply ignore this error as it is not harmful.

ka04u000000Hd9iAAC,kA04u0000000JZhCAM,"Rolling-Log Fix: ""AgentTaskRunner - task execution failed for task 11 - TrackerPollTask-Baseline-processtracker-88""","

This article will assist with clearing the error below from showing up in your Rolling Log.
<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
Example Error Message
2018-04-10 10:56:26,887 [7] ERROR AgentTaskRunner - task execution failed for task 11 - TrackerPollTask-Baseline-processtracker-88
NNT.Agent.Tracking.TrackerException: no data collector registered for: processtracker-local
configuration, NNT.Agent.Core.Interfaces.IItemStoragePipeline queue, NNT.Agent.Core.Tracking.PollType pollType, System.DateTime pollStartTimeUtc) [0x0004c] in:0
at NNT.Agent.Core.Tracking.TrackerBase.Poll (NNT.Agent.Core.Tracking.PollControl pollControl, NNT.Agent.Core.Interfaces.IDevice device, NNT.Agent.Core.Interfaces.IItemStoragePipeline queue,
at NNT.Agent.Core.Application.AgentTaskRunner.ExecuteTask (System.Int32 runnerId, NNT.Agent.Core.Interfaces.IAgentTask task, System.DateTime nowUtc, NNT.Agent.Core.Queue.AgentTaskQueue queue)

This error is usually caused due to the process tracker in change tracker being enabled, but no specified processes are set to be tracked. To stop this error from occuring, you will need to edit the configuration template assigned to the device that the error is occuring on, and either input at least one process to track, or disable the tracker

ka04u000000Hd9fAAC,kA04u0000000JZSCA2,Log Tracker Custom Alerting: Generating alerts off event contents.,"

Example: You are monitoring syslog messages being generated by a Windows Server. One of the messages that you have specifically correlated is for when administrator accounts fail to login to the system. Within each of these events, there is an account name listed. Seeing multiple messages which contain the same account name within a short time period, may indicate a brute force attack. You would like to setup an alert which will generate a ticket but only if they see the same account name within a message, 5 times within a 30 second period. In order to do this, please follow the instructions below:

Log Tracker Version 5-8-1 is required in order for you to use this functionality.

  • Log into Log Tracker
  • Select the Alerts tab
  • Select the Custom tab
  • Select the Wizard >
column3:
button
  • Set the Custom Alert Type to: Parse Value Alert
  • Select the Next >
column4:
button
  • Set your Correlation Thread to: “an account failed to log on” events>
column6:
button
  • Set the Compare Function to: (GE) Greater Than Or Equal
  • Set the Threshold to: 5
  • Set the Execute Interval to: 30
  • Select the Next >
column7:
button
  • Set the Alert Facility to:
  • Set the Alert Severity to:
  • Set Assign Ticket To User to:
  • Set Send Clear Severity to:
  • Select the Next >
column8:
button

column3: s user accounts should change the default passwords to secure/strong passwords right away. This is an area which may be overlooked by IT staff but weak and/or default credentials could be exploited by attackers to propagate an attack if a system is compromised.
column4: >The PCI-DSS specifically state in requirement 2 that an organisation can not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters.
column5: >With that being the case, an organisation may chose to include mixed case, numbers and even special characters when creating unique/secure passwords. ka04u000000Hd9SAAS,kA04u0000000JYPCA2,"Compliance Reports do not Complete, Stuck in Processing xx %","

NNT has seen instances over the years of Change Tracker servers unable to run compliance reports against registered devices. When this occurs the '
column3: value for the report will display &#39
column6: >arbitrary completion percentage that never reaches 100%.
column9:
asPdf=false"">

Rather than this being a problem on the target device against which the report is being run, testing has shown that IIS specific security tools have the ability to block Change Tracker'
column10:
s collection of the report information and therefore the report never completes.

By far the most common security tool NNT encounters which causes this problem is UrlScan. UrlScan
column11: >helps to prevent potentially harmful requests from reaching applications on the server by <span style=""color: rgb(31,40,52)
column12: >screening all incoming requests, filtering the requests based on rules that are set by the administrator. Filtering requests helps secure the server by ensuring that only valid requests are processed.One such filtering option is to prevent Transfer-Encoding. Such a prevention filter in UrlScan impacts Change Tracker as <span style=""color: rgb(31,40,52)
column14:
>Transfer-Encoding is uses to gather the report data together from a remote system.


Step-by-step guide

To prevent UrlScan from blocking
column18:
>Transfer-Encoding, follow these steps.

  1. Move to the UrlScan install location at C:\Windows\system32/inetsrv/urlscan
  2. Locate the .ini file which controls all filtering options and open the ini file in a text editor
  3. Search through the file for the entry '
column21: at the start of the line, the finished line should look like this:
column22:
Transfer-Encoding:
  • Save and close the ini file
  • Restart IIS

ka04u000000Hd9RAAS,kA04u0000000JYKCA2,How to Stop Change Tracker from Blocking IP Address,"

This problem occurs when a user fails a login 3 times or more from a remote device. Change Tracker will block the IP address of that device for some time.


Resolution

This problem can be resolved, and can be modified to instead lock out the account that the user is trying to log into after 3 unsuccessful logon attempts instead. 


Step-by-Step

  1. Open Command Prompt (Admin Privilages)
  2. Type
column2:
>iisreset /stop (This will stop IIS). Do not close Command Prompt, for now, please minimize it.
  • Open Notepad (Admin Privilages)
  • Click File >
column8:
button

  • Upon opening the file you should see something similar to below:











  • In the configuration, notice the "
column10:
Value. This value is responsible for the behavior of failed authentications. Below are the explanations of what changing this value will result in:

         = This will block the IP after 3 failed attempts for unspecified amount of time (This is the default setting)
          = This will lock the account out for 10 minutes after 3 failed attempts

  • Replace value="
column14:
if you prefer that Change Tracker lock the account out for 10 minutes after 3 failed attempts rather than blocking the IP address.
  • Once done, click on File >
column15:
Save and close out the document. Re-open to make sure the settings are retained.
  • Back to the command prompt, Type iisreset /start (This will start IIS).


    • Thats it! your Change Tracker server should no longer be blocking IP Addresses.

    ",2023-05-08T10:17:35.000+0000,Online

column1: ka04u000000Hd9NAAS,kA04u0000000JY6CAM,"Rolling-Log Fix: ""FileContentTrackerDataCollectorLocal - Couldnt locate file entry for /mydirectory/my.file""","<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
column2:
>
Example Error Message

>What Does It Mean?

This error occurs when you have your configuration template in Change Tracker looking to track file contents on a certain file. In this case, we are looking to track "
column4: This error means that the agent could not locate this file.
column5:
>How Can I Fix This / Should I Worry?

If you are recieving this for a file that actually does not exist, then no, do not worry. If you are using one template to track multiple agents, and some agents do have the file, while others dont, it is not a problem to let it track this file. The only caution to have with this is the amount of files it is looking for. If the template grows exponentially, having a large volume of these errors may cause performance issues, however, in most cases, it is perfectly fine.


If you are positive the file exists, but are getting this error, do the following

  1. Check your configuration template. Is it looking for the file in the same place you have placed the file?
  2. Is this a file that is in different places on different servers? if so, please define all of the potential spots in the template.
  3. Does this file have special permissions that do not allow it to be read by our agent? If so, adjust the file permissions, or adjust the privilages of the account our agent uses.
column6:
>In most cases, you can simply ignore this error as it is not harmful.

ka04u000000Hd9DAAS,kA04u0000000JXbCAM,What Change Tracker Gen7 Objects to Monitor Using Application Performance Monitoring (APM) Tools,"

This document indicates our recommendations for monitoring the health of your NNT Server and Agents. We have listed several variables that can be monitored utilizing application performance monitoring tools for monitoring the Server and Agents. 

Services

WAS 
Track this on your NNT Hub Server to monitor the IIS Service


W3SVC
Track this on your NNT Hub Server to monitor the IIS Service


MongoDB
Track this on your NNT Hub Server to monitor that the Mongo Database is running


Gen7Agent
Track this on all of your Windows Agents &
column2:
NNT Hub Server to monitor that the NNT Agent Service is running


nntgen7agent
Track this on all of your Red Hat and Debian based Distros to monitor that the NNT Agent Service is Running

Processes:

Gen7Agent.Service.exe
Track this on all of your windows based agents and hub server to make sure the NNT Agent process is running


w3wp or IIS Worker Process (w3wp.exe)
Track this on your NNT Hub Server to make sure that IIS Process is running


MongoD or MongoDB Database Server (mongod.exe)
Track this on your NNT Hub Server to make sure that the Mongo Database Process is running

Default Software Paths:

C:\inetpub\wwwroot\Change Tracker Generation 7 Hub
C:\inetpub\wwwroot\Change Tracker Generation 7 WebUI
C:\Program Files\NNT Change Tracker Suite
C:\ProgramData\NNT
C:\ProgramData\Change Tracker Generation 7

Drivers/Dependencies:

NNT WHO MADE THE CHANGE DRIVER - C:\Windows\System32\drivers\NNTInfo.sys

.NET FRAMEWORK/Mono Runtime 3.5 - If you are using a NNT 6.5 Agent (Version Example: 1.0.0.106) - Make sure that this does not get uninstalled, or downgraded to an older version

.NET FRAMEWORK/Mono Runtime 4.5 - If you are using a NNT Gen7 Agent (Version 7.0.0.29) - Make sure that this does not get uninstalled, or downgraded to an older version. If you need to use an older version due to a critical application, use a 6.5 Agent instead.

.NET FRAMEWORK/Mono Runtime 4.6.1 - For the NNT Change Tracker Generation 7 Hub Server, (Version 7.0.1.48 or Newer) - Make sure that this does not get uninstalled, or downgraded to an older version.

Potential Syslog Thresholds / Messages:

Agent Error - This messaging type shows any errors that Change Tracker Agents are experiencing. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Audit (Device Admin) - This messaging type shows any changes to device configurations. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Audit (System Config Change) - This messaging type shows any changes to system settings for Change Tracker server configurations. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Audit (User Administration) - This messaging type shows any changes to User Settings for Change Tracker console. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Audit (Device Details Change) - This messaging type shows any changes to the details of an agent device. 

Device Offline - This messaging type shows when an agent goes offline. 

Device Online - This messaging type shows when an agent goes offline. 

New Device Registered - This messaging type shows when an new agent registers to the NNT Hub Server 

System Error - This messaging type shows when the Change Tracker Server is exeriencing an error. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Planned and Unplanned Changes - This messaging type shows when the Change Tracker Server recieves planned or unplanned changes. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Event Type: Communications - This messaging type shows communications between agent and hub server. It is reccomended that you build a threshold mechanism that searches for this kind of message from the change tracker server, and alerts the proper response teams.

Event Type: Audit - This messaging type shows audit information for Change Tracker, such as user account managment, configuration changes, etc. It is reccomended that you monitor for this, and build threshold mechanisims if needed.

Log Files:

NNT 6.5 AGENT

On Windows

C:\Program Files\NNT Change Tracker Suite\Agent\rolling-log.txt

C:\Program Files\NNT Change Tracker Suite\Agent\HubDetails.xml

On Linux

/opt/nnt/agent/bin/rolling-log.txt

/opt/nnt/agent/bin/HubDetails.xml


NNT GEN7 AGENT

On Windows

C:\ProgramData\NNT\gen7agent.service\rolling-log.txt

C:\ProgramData\NNT\gen7agent.service\HubDetails.xml

On Linux

/var/nnt/gen7agent.service/rolling-log.txt

/var/nnt/gen7agent.service/HubDetails.xml


Change Tracker Server / Database Logs

Hub Service Log (Linux) - /opt/nnt/hubservice/log/hubservice-log.txt

Hub Service Log (Windows) - C:\inetpub\wwwroot\Change Tracker Generation 7 Hub\log\hubservice-log.txt

MongoDB Log (Linux) - /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log

MongoDB Log (Windows) - C:\ProgramData\Change Tracker Generation 7\MongoDB\log\mongod.log


Things to Keep in Mind

NNT Change Tracker Hub Server:

  • The percentage of memory in use on a server should not be monitored as MongoDB prefers to reserve as much as possible. The reserved memory is known as the "
column4: however, the memory that is actually in use is defined by the &quot
column6: . An Example of this is the screenshot below:
column9:
asPdf=false"">

NNT Change Tracker Agents:

  • The NNT Change Tracker Gen7 Agent is built using .NET Framework. Applications that are based off .NET Framework may allocate different amounts of memory at different times. Keep in mind that .NET Framework has a Garbage Collecting function, which determines the best time for the system to clean up current memory banks which the application no longer needs. All in all, memory usage for .NET applications is a difficult metric to gauge, as in most scenarios, the application is not really utilizing all the memory that has been assigned to it, and the .NET Framework portion of the application will allocate and de-allocate the memory as per the system’s needs.

  • An Agent Performance Metrics and Footprint guide has been created. If you want this, please notify NNT Support with the request and we can send you the latest version.


",2023-05-08T10:17:25.000+0000,Online

ka04u000000Hd9FAAS,kA04u0000000JXdCAM,"Hubservice-Log Fix: Command aggregate failed: Sort exceeded memory limit of 104857600 bytes, but did not opt in to external sorting. Aborting operation. Pass allowDiskUse:true to opt in","

Problem

You are unable to log into Change Tracker, receiving the error username or password incorrect.

The Mongodb service is running as is the IIS service and upon looking into the log for Change Tracker Hub, the hubservice-log.txt found here by default -C:\inetpub\wwwroot\Change Tracker Generation 7 Hub\log the below error is listed and repeats:

MongoDB.Driver.MongoCommandException: Command aggregate failed: Sort exceeded memory limit of 104857600 bytes, but did not opt in to external sorting. Aborting operation. Pass allowDiskUse:true to opt in..
column4:
asPdf=false"">

Solution

The cause of the error has been found to be a sub-optimal query running during the hub service start up. This has been fixed in later releases of the software7.0.1.58 and onwards.

For earlier versions of Change Tracker, perform the task listed below to rectify the issue.

Log into the Change Tracker server and open a command prompt to perform the following commands:


cd "
column6:
mongo.exe
use NNTHubService
db.SystemDirectory.createIndex({OrganizationId:1, _t:1, DisplayName:1})

The output of the command should be:


{
"
column14:
: 1
}

Attempt to once again log into Change Tracker.

ka04u000000Hd99AAC,kA04u0000000JXICA2,"Rolling-Log Fix: ""RegistryTrackerDataCollector - check the agent process has the required permissions to access the registry key. The specified registry key does not exist.""","<div class=""code panel pdl conf-macro output-block"" style=""border-width: 1px
column2:
>
Example Error Message

column1: 2017-10-02 09:14:38,759 [9] ERROR RegistryTrackerDataCollector - check the agent process has the required permissions to access the registry key. (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\ExampleService\Parameters, error: The specified registry key does not exist.)

column2:
>What Does It Mean?

This error occurs when you have your configuration template in Change Tracker looking to track a registry key and the agent cannot access the registry key because it is not found or it does not have proper permissions.
column3:
>How Can I Fix This / Should I Worry?

If you are receiving this for a registry key that actually does not exist, then no, do not worry. If you are using one template to track multiple agents, and some agents do have the key, while others dont, it is not a problem to let it track this key. The only caution to have with this is the amount of keys it is looking for. If the template grows exponentially, having a large volume of these errors may cause performance issues, however, in most cases, it is perfectly fine.


If you are positive the registry key exists, but are getting this error, do the following

  1. Check your configuration template. Is it looking for the key in the same place you have placed the file?
  2. Is this a registry key that is in different places on different servers? if so, please define all of the potential spots in the template.
  3. Does this agent have special permissions that do not allow it to access the registry? If so, adjust the permissions to allow this.
column4:
>In most cases, you can simply ignore this error as it is not harmful.

Change Tracker has an Auto Update process for windows based agents. This process is initiated from the Hub server.
The following steps below will show you how to upload an update to your Change Tracker Server for Agents to be updated.
1 - On our website, you need to download the agent zip file and agent updater zip file. Move both the Agent and Agent updater zip files to the same directory
2. Once you have downloaded the two files, and moved them to the same directory - Log into your change tracker console, and go to the "

column1: After this, the agents are ready to be assigned to the proper group to receive the updates. Follow the steps below to assign them to the proper group
The following steps below will show you how to assign an uploaded update package the the correct group of agents to be updated.

column5: button. Select the group that the agent update needs to be assigned to (it will be highlighted in blue when selected) and click on the &quot
column7: tab. From here, you can set the update schedule by pressing the &quot

ka04u000000Hd8hAAC,kA04u0000000JVfCAM,How to Reset the Default Admin Password on Change Tracker,"

This function is only available from the localhost and therefore can only be run by a high privilege user with logon rights to the Change Tracker host server

CentOS Based Hub

From a command line interface on the CentOS host itself, enter the following command:

$ wget --no-check-certificate -qO- https://localhost/api/resetadminpassword
column4:
asPdf=false"">

This will write the reset password to a file called resetpassword or resetpassword.x if multiple resets have been attempted. The file will be in the directory from which the wget command was run.

Windows Based Hub

Using the browser on the Windows Hub machine itself enter the following into the address bar:

https://localhost/api/resetadminpassword
column7:
asPdf=false"">


The password displayed will be your new password. At next logon to the Change Tracker Gen 7 web GUI you will be able to logon using the reset password but will also be prompted to change the password to one of your choice.If you are not prompted to change your password, follow the instructions below.

If you where not prompted to change your password

Sometimes you will not be prompted to change your password. In order to manually change it, you will need to log in using your new passsword, and proceed by going to the "
column13: on the left navigation panel. This should bring up the User Administration page on your screen. To reset the password, click on the blue paperclip next to the account name you want to reset (In this case, it would be &quot
column15: )
column18:
asPdf=false"">


Upon clicking the blue paperclip, you will be prompted to type a new password, and confirm this password. Once you have done this, click "
column20:
- Your new password should be immediately available for use.

ka04u000000Hd8gAAC,kA04u0000000JVbCAM,How to monitor legacy systems with the Change Tracker Express Agent?,"

Do you have legacy systems (AIX, Solaris etc.) that you need to monitor for File Integrity changes? Do you need to be notified of changes in real time? Do you need to know what user made the change? Then the "
column3:
is for you! Review the guide below for information on how to install the agent and configure it to register with a Change Tracker server. The example below was captured on an AIX server:

Unlike our normal Change Tracker Gen 7 agent which requires either .NET (for Windows) or Mono (for Linux), the Express Agent is intended to be a lightweight agent that can be built and deployed to more legacy platforms where it is only possible to compile C/C++ code.

The Express Agent is available as an RPM for easy installation onto something like an AIX server. The RPM'
column4:
s can be found on the Members Download area on the NNT website. If you require assistance location the correct installers, please contact the NNT Support team.


Once the RPM files have been downloaded, copy it onto the endpoint that you would like to monitor.

Installation of the RPM can be done using the "
column6:
command (example below)

bash-4.2# rpm -ivh nnt-changetracker-expressagent-2.0.1.2-38.ppc.rpm

nnt-changetracker-expressagent

##################################################

Once the RPM is installed, you can configure the agent to register with a Change Tracker server using a shell script that NNT provide as part of the agent installation:

=================================================================================
Express Agent install complete.
Now run /opt/nnt/expressagent/configure-expressagent.sh to complete installation.
=================================================================================

The agent will be installed into the /opt/nnt/expressagent directory with HubDetails.xml, log files, databases written to the /var/nnt/expressagent directory:

bash-4.2# ./configure-expressagent.sh
Welcome to the NNT ChangeTracker Express Agent Configuration script

Hub URL [https://localhost/api/] : https://192.168.1.1/api/
Agent username [agent] : agent
Agent password : passWord121
Agent config path [/var/nnt/expressagent] : /var/nnt/expressagent

==================================================================
The Express Agent will be configured with the following settings :
Hub URL : https://192.1681.1/api/
Agent user : agent
Agent password :
Config path : /var/nnt/expressagent
==================================================================
column9:
asPdf=false"">

Once the agent has been installed, the status of the service can be checked by running the following command:

# ps -def | grep express

The configure-expressagent.sh script will start the agent however if you need to start or stop the service manually you can run the service scripts directly:

# /etc/rc.d/rc2.d/Snntexpressagent.sh start

or

# /etc/rc.d/rc2.d/Knntexpressagent.sh stop
column12:
asPdf=false"">


In order for the Change Tracker Express Agent to function correctly, the following libraries will need to be in place on the system:

./expressAgent needs:

         /usr/lib/libc.a(shr.o)

         /usr/lib/libpthread.a(shr_xpg5.o)

         /opt/nnt/expressagent/libcrypto.a(libcrypto.so.1.0.2)

         /usr/lib/libpthread.a(shr_comm.o)

         /opt/nnt/expressagent/libssl.a(libssl.so.1.0.2)

         /unix

         /usr/lib/libcrypt.a(shr.o)

         /usr/lib/libpthreads.a(shr_comm.o)

         /usr/lib/libc.a(shr_64.o)

         /usr/lib/libpthreads.a(shr_xpg5_64.o)

         /usr/lib/libcrypt.a(shr_64.o)
column15:
asPdf=false"">

If you require any further information on the Express Agent or assistance with installing it, please open a support ticket on Jira or email support@nntws.com.

Contents will not be tracked, file length is bigger than current filecontentmaxforextension limit: (701206 bytes)
How to Increase the Default File Content Maximum:
To increase the maximum file content size:

1. Stop the Gen7Agent Service
     
  2. Navigate to and edit C:\Program Files\NNT Change Tracker Suite\Gen7Agent\
Look for the following lines of code - Generally this will be in line 11 and 12:
Edit the value to represent the number which you want to increase it to. Note that the higher the number, the more resources and time it takes to process file contents (

column2: >We have built in file content limits on the agent and if these are exceeded file-contents will not be performed.

Alerting - Being Notified of Events

Once devices have been assigned to Device Groups and a Configuration Template has been assigned, a Baseline of the configuration will be recorded and thereafter, any changes detected can be reported as email or syslog alerts.

Each user of the Change Tracker system can be assigned a personalized alerting profile from a range of event options for each Device Group.

Access the User Notification Email page via Settings ->
column2:
User Notification Emails and select a user, then dial in Notification Types for the selected Device Group.

Note: Core system settings such as the Syslog Server and SMTP details will also need to be defined via Settings ->

ka04u000000Hd8SAAS,kA04u0000000JUmCAM,7. Comparing Compliance Scores for Devices,"

The Compliance tab provides an overview of compliance scores for all devices within any selected group.

The screen shows the previous 7 compliance report results in order to track any drift against your selected hardened build standard and whether scores are improving or worsening.
column4:
asPdf=false"">

Any individual report can be viewed by clicking the result score, and reports selected using the checkboxes can be exported in a range of formats (pdf, excel or csv) with an option to select more detailed results (Note: Report results will be provided via a link for the Dashboard – this approach is taken so that even for large exports that may take minutes to prepare, there is a structured process for delivering report results)
column7:
asPdf=false"">

Comparing Results

By selecting any two results, either for the same device or for two different devices, the ‘Compare Results’ button becomes available.

This will run a compare of the two reports, useful for seeing what has caused a score to drop, or to establish what the difference is in configuration between two devices.
